page.title: 06HISTORIC MONUMENT ST.NINIANS
page.content: {Robert the Bruce,}riding his bronze charger, is situated on a spot two miles from{Stirling.}This monument commemorates a battle, fought in 1314 which the Scots won. King Edward ran back to England. The Head of the Bruce Family, the{Earl {of Elgin}raised money for the fifty four acre site to house the statue in 1964. He then added a visitor's centre with an audio-visual film telling of the battle.This was opened by{Queen {Elisabeth}on the twentyfourth of June 1967. A rotunda, with a flag pole in the centre, has also been added and surrounding everything is a large grassy area on which children may play and picnics are eaten. If you wish to purchase a souvenir there is a shop in the{Heritage Centre}for pencils, keyrings, honey, tablet etc. The N.T.S now look after the site.(C.SIBBALD)
